name: sql-crack
description: Visualize SQL queries with interactive flow diagrams

commands.title: SQL Crack: Show Workspace UX Metrics

enumDescriptions: SQL Server / T-SQL dialect (alias for TransactSQL)
sqlCrack.defaultDialect.description: Default SQL dialect for parsing queries

sqlCrack.syncEditorToFlow.description: Highlight flow nodes when clicking in SQL editor

enumDescriptions: Opens beside the SQL file (like Markdown preview)
Opens as a new tab in the editor area (default)
sqlCrack.viewLocation.description: Where to display the SQL visualization panel

enumDescriptions: Radial layout (root at center, levels as rings)
Data flows from top to bottom (default)
Data flows from bottom to top (Snowflake query profile style â€” tables at bottom, results at top)
sqlCrack.flowDirection.description: Direction of data flow in the visualization. Bottom-up matches Snowflake query profile style where table scans start at the bottom and results flow upward.

sqlCrack.autoRefresh.description: Automatically refresh visualization when SQL file changes (with debounce)

sqlCrack.autoRefreshDelay.description: Delay in milliseconds before auto-refresh triggers (default: 500ms)

sqlCrack.workspaceAutoIndexThreshold.description: Maximum number of SQL files to auto-index on workspace analysis (larger workspaces require manual confirmation)

sqlCrack.workspaceLineageDepth.description: Default lineage traversal depth for Lineage and Table Explorer views

enumDescriptions: File-level dependency graph. Nodes are SQL files; edges show which files reference tables defined in other files.
Table-level dependency graph. Nodes are tables/views; edges show references (SELECT, JOIN, INSERT, etc.).
sqlCrack.workspaceGraphDefaultMode.description: Default mode for the Workspace Dependencies Graph tab. Used when the panel loads or when you refresh the index.

sqlCrack.advanced.cacheTTLHours.description: Cache time-to-live in hours. Set to 0 to disable caching. Index will be rebuilt after this time. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.clearCacheOnStartup.description: Always rebuild index when VS Code opens the workspace. Overrides cache TTL. (Advanced)

enumDescriptions: Dot grid pattern (subtle dots at intersections)
Line grid pattern (default, subtle grid lines)
sqlCrack.gridStyle.description: Background grid pattern style for visualizations

enumDescriptions: Color accent strip on the left edge of nodes (default)
Color accent strip on the bottom edge of nodes
sqlCrack.nodeAccentPosition.description: Position of the color accent strip on visualization nodes

sqlCrack.showMinimap.description: Controls when the minimap overview is displayed

enumDescriptions: Optimize graph colors for deuteranopia (green-red deficiency)
Optimize graph colors for protanopia (red weakness)
Optimize graph colors for tritanopia (blue-yellow deficiency)
sqlCrack.colorblindMode.description: Color accessibility mode for SQL flow and warning visuals. Adds shape/dash cues alongside color.

sqlCrack.advanced.defaultTheme.description: Default theme for SQL Crack visualizations. 'auto' matches VS Code theme, 'dark' or 'light' forces a specific theme. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.showDiagnosticsInProbl.markdownDescription: Show SQL Crack parser/performance hints in VS Code Problems panel. Disabled by default to reduce noise; enable when you want lint-like feedback in Problems. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.showDeadColumnHints.markdownDescription: Show hints for columns selected but not used in WHERE/ORDER BY/GROUP BY/HAVING/JOIN clauses. Disable if you get too many false positives (columns used by application layer). (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.combineDdlStatements.markdownDescription: Combine consecutive DDL statements (CREATE TABLE, CREATE VIEW, etc.) into a single visualization block. Useful for schema files with many DDL statements. Shows count of tables/views created. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.maxFileSizeKB.markdownDescription: Maximum SQL file size in KB before the parser truncates or rejects the input. Increase for very large SQL files. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.maxStatements.markdownDescription: Maximum number of SQL statements to parse in a single file. Statements beyond this limit are skipped. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.parseTimeoutSeconds.markdownDescription: Maximum time in seconds for parsing a single SQL file. Prevents the extension from hanging on very complex queries. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.debugLogging.markdownDescription: Enable verbose debug logging to the SQL Crack output channel. Useful for troubleshooting. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.advanced.workspaceUxInstrumenta.markdownDescription: Enable local-only Workspace Graph UX interaction metrics in the SQL Crack output channel. No external telemetry is sent. (Advanced)

sqlCrack.customAggregateFunctions.description: Additional aggregate function names to recognize (e.g., ["MY_CUSTOM_AGG", "COMPANY_SUM"]). These are added to the built-in dialect functions.

sqlCrack.customWindowFunctions.description: Additional window function names to recognize (e.g., ["MY_CUSTOM_RANK"]). These are added to the built-in dialect functions.

sqlCrack.additionalFileExtensions.markdownDescription: Additional file extensions to treat as SQL files (e.g., `[".tpt", ".dbsql", ".hql", ".bteq"]`). Extensions should include the leading dot. These files will show the SQL Crack icon in the editor title bar and can be visualized.

walkthroughs.title: Get Started with SQL Crack
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to visualize SQL queries, explore workspace dependencies, and trace column lineage.

steps.title: Open a SQL file
steps.description:
Open any `.sql` file in your workspace to get started.

[Open a SQL file](command:workbench.action.quickOpen)

steps.title: Visualize your query
steps.description:
Press `Cmd+Shift+L` (Mac) or `Ctrl+Shift+L` (Windows/Linux) to open the interactive flow diagram.

[Visualize SQL Query](command:sql-crack.visualize)

steps.title: Explore workspace dependencies
steps.description:
See how your SQL files relate to each other. Right-click a folder in Explorer and choose **Analyze Workspace Dependencies**.

[Analyze Workspace](command:sql-crack.analyzeWorkspace)

steps.title: Try column lineage
steps.description: Press `C` while viewing a query visualization to toggle column-level lineage. Click a column to trace its data flow through the query.
